title: don't use ParsedArgs in rawDebugSession; fixes #80461
Emmet not working in Portable Mode
body:
This is my first ever bug report.
I noticed that Emmet doesn't work with VSCode v1.38.1.0 in Portable Mode.

If you start VSCode, Emmet will either work once and then stop working, or it will not work at all.

Changing settings that might be related to auto-suggest and Emmet doesn't make any difference. Pressing [Ctrl+Space] shows "Loading..." in the suggestion menu and it doesn't load any suggestions.

The issue happens even with all extensions disabled.

Portable Mode is setup as described on VSCode [site](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/portable).
Auto Suggest is ON (also doesn't work with OFF).

Haven't tried the Insider version.

Windows 10 (1809)

title: Git: "git not found" error, macOS, when xcodebuild license needs renewing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: It appears that on macOS if xcodebuild license needs renewing VSCode throws a "git not found" error. ``` Lukes-iMac-2:skatex lukepighetti$ git Agreeing to the Xcode/iOS license requires admin privileges, please run “sudo xcodebuild -license” and then retry this command. ``` Aaaaand now it works

title: [Feature] Allow extension webviews to have proper tooltip in Explorer
body:
**Description**
It would be nice if extension webviews could have  a human readable tooltip in the explorer. Not something like "\webview-panel\webview...". I found nothing in the extension API to set the explorer tooltip. The webview-sample (https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/tree/master/webview-sample) shows this generic tooltip as well. 

- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 

![Webview-tooltip](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55053134/65387233-82e46980-dd45-11e9-9dd0-4163a4c0f5c4.gif)

title: Changes v1.38 in to autoClosingBrackets vs Completion order is breaking intellisense
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38
- OS Version: Windows 10 1903 Build 18362.356

In the [AL Language](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-dynamics-smb.al) extension we offer both keyword intellisense and autoClosingBrackets for our block keywords. The AL Language is Pascal based e.g. blocks are surrounded with begin/end.

Our language configuration.json contains 

```
    "autoClosingPairs": [
        { "open": "begin", "close": "end;", "notIn": ["string", "comment"] }
    ],

```

At the same time we offer generic contextual keyword intellisense based on our syntax definition through a CompletionRequest.

Up until v1.38 this worked perfectly. The user started typing "begin" was presented with the begin keyword completion when selected the autoClosingPairs kicked in a inserted the closing pairs. 
Begining from v1.38 something has changed. When begin is typed fully out then closing "end;" is shown but when typing <enter> to split the begin/end; then the closing "end;" is deleted. 

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Download and install the AL Language extension
2. Use the AL:Go! command from the command palette to get a skeleton project
3. After the Message() in the trigger start type begin followed by <enter>

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: No

title: Go to file: prefix with / to prefer results in root
body:
I'd like to open `index.html` in root. Using the "go to file" feature for that is currently not friendly because it's a 14th match. In general, the sorting feels totally random.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/611746/65364240-20b92680-dbd6-11e9-8160-c4a941257677.png)

Feature request: prepend the search with `/`, e.g. `/index.html` to indicate which index.html I want.

title: Clicking Markdown link in preview should not open new tab if file is already open
body:
## Current behavior

The current behavior is very confusing to me.  Take the following example:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29213686/65337537-f6dc1180-db8d-11e9-8c2b-420f16cb2f26.png)

Two editor tabs are open in the left group, one containing TestA.md and the other TestB.md.  In the right group is the preview tab.  Each Markdown file has a link to the other file.  Clicking the link in the preview tab opens a new editor tab (containing the linked file) in the same group as the preview tab (despite the file already being open):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29213686/65337837-939eaf00-db8e-11e9-832f-c18c6a1ff586.png)

## Desired behavior

Clicking a link in the preview should focus (i.e., bring forward) the existing editor tab containing the linked file (if it is already open).  So clicking the link to TestB.md in TestA.md should result in the follow state:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29213686/65338000-e1b3b280-db8e-11e9-9523-fd6bf2f5bffc.png)

title: Terminal window doesn't open at startup
body:
Issue Type: Bug I changed my Terminal->Integrated: Cwd setting to "$(workspaceFolder)". Now, when Code starts up, the Terminal does not open, and I get a notification: "The terminal shell CWD "/home/gpudb/gpudb-dev-7.0/gpudb-core/gaiadb-cluster/${workspaceFolder}" does not exist". This happens every time I launch Code. However, once Code has loaded, I can then do Ctrl-` to open a Terminal window, and it works as expected (also every time). Note that this is doing Remote development (so the Terminal is opening a session on my remote machine). I suspect the issue is that Code is trying to start the Terminal before $workspaceFolder is set, but it is set later, when I manually open the Terminal. It is a fairly easy work-around, but am reporting it in case this is not the expected behavior. title: editor.suggest.filteredTypes doesn't respect deleting a filter
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In settings.json add editor.sugges,t.filterTypes which prefills with keyword and snippet true
2. Bring up suggestions to see other available filters (displayed with property icon).
3. Add "property": false and now IntelliSense doesn't have available filter suggestions.
4. Set "property:" true and filter suggestions are back.
5. Set "property": false again and no filter suggestions as expected.
6. Delete the "property": false entry.

No filter suggestions. editor.suggest.filterTypes doesn't detect that property filter was removed.

7. Reload Window and then filter suggestions come back.

title: Folder structure in find references view
body:
If a pretty large project is opened in vs.code, and references are found, they are displayed in a linear view. It would be nice to have an option to display them in a folder view, i.e. only relevant folders and files are shown, and usages are shown as children of file nodes.

I think I am capable of implementing it myself. Do you think it's a useful thing to do? Can I expect some directions on this from somebody on the team?

title: Add an "actionables only" option to editor.hover.sticky

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
The `editor.hover.sticky` setting is `true` by default, which helps with hovers like the color picker. However, I often find myself very annoyingly having to click away of the hover box to see hover information from lines above.

My suggestion is to distinguish between actionable and non-actionable hover boxes so that you can have `"all"`, `"actionableOnly"` and `"off"` options in `editor.hover.sticky`setting, such that actionable hovers like the color picker are still sticky, but non-actionable ones are not.

title: Move startDebugging options from proposed to official API
Loosen/customize fuzzy file search matching (path separator)
body:
I'm on a Mac, so my path separator is a forward slash `/`.

In PHP, namespaces are always backslashes `\` and normally reflect the file/folder structure.

In other editors (Atom), the fuzzy matching was looser, so I could `⌘+P` and paste in a PHP namespace (eg `Illuminate\Foundation\Http\Kernel`), and it would still match the path `src/Illuminate/Foundation/Http/Kernel.php`.

Ideally, there could be a setting for a regex exclusion pattern for the fuzzy search.

Or…explicitly just allow both `/` and `\` to still match :)

title: Git: Repository not detected if root folder ends in [space]
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: MacOS High Sierra 10.13.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Fresh Git install (git version 2.23.0)
2. Fresh VSCode install (1.38.1)
3. Source Control tab in activity bar shows `no source control provider registered`
4. Settings shows in `settings.json`: `"git.enabled": true`
5. Find git location in terminal `"/usr/local/bin/git"`
6. Added `"git.path": "/usr/local/bin/git"`to `settings.json` to attempt to fix the bug
7. Source Control tab in activity bar shows still shows "no source control provider registered"
8. When clicking on the `+` sign on top right corner of Source Control tab, it add a `.git`folder in the workspace folder.  Confirmed by `ls -al ./`
9. Trying `Git: Show Git Output`=> `Looking for git in: /usr/local/bin/git Using git 2.23.0 from /usr/local/bin/git`
10. Checked `@builtin Git` Extension enabled

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

I have just started to use VSCode, but my git installation is not detected by the Source Control Tab.  If I work in a directory without using git, I can initialize a `.git` folder with the `+` sign, but I can't make commit. If I am in a directory with already a git tracking, I still have this `no source control provider registered` message.

title: Maximize button not working properly
body:
Version: 1.39.0-insider (user setup)
Commit: cc481ab31b5827add5f99a770f2c860d0575df69
Date: 2019-09-18T07:02:14.165Z
Electron: 6.0.9
Chrome: 76.0.3809.146
Node.js: 12.4.0
V8: 7.6.303.31-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start VS code in normal window state
2. Maximize it through the maximize button

Expected result - VS Code maximizes and the button changes to it's maximized glyph, user is able to restore to normal window through the same button
Actual result - VS Code maximizes visually, BUT the window actually just takes the screen size while remains draggable and the glyph remains the one for the normal state. The user is unable to restore normal state by clicking ti again.

Note : the maximize/restore by double clicking the title bar works normally.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Allow to single click file to replace active tab and doubleclick to open new tab
body:
I can not configure Visual Studio Code in a way, that when single clicking on a file in the file explorer of the project, it just opens the file in the currently active tab.

I did not find any extensions that give me that feature.

Single click open file has been setup by the following configuration.

    "workbench.list.openMode": "singleClick",

I know there are `Preview`-tabs. But it opens in a new tab. That creates a problem that the tab vanishes when in Preview.
When I do not use `Preview`-tabs I get many open tabs after clicking some files, for example when checking or searching for something.

My main use case for me when using the project explorer: Switching to another file without opening new tabs. I have the navigation buttons for going back. I mainly use Xcode and it would be nice to mimic its behavior: Single click to replace current tab with the file you clicked on, double click to open file in new tab.

title: VS Code terminates if when clicking Debug -> Start without Debugging for extension tests
body:
- Run `yo code` to generate the sample TypeScript extension
- Open in VS Code
- Click `Debug` -> `Start Without Debugging`
- VS Code completely vanishes

It used to output a message about not being able to run tests from the command line while an instance of VS Code is open (a slightly misleading message, and a frustrating limitation, but at least it was clear what happened). Now, VS Code just disappears as if it crashed. This seems like rather undesirable behaviour.

I often run things without the debugger when I know I won't be debugging (for various reasons) so out of habit I often hit Ctrl+F5. Having to restart VS Code seems like a high penalty for that mistake :-)

title: Use Replace button in "Find and Replace" widthout jumping to next matching word
body:
When i want to Find and Repalce some text i want to verify and update the whitespace to match the new text. 

Every time i hit replace, the focus jumps to the next matching text, i have to scroll back manually to edit the whitespace (or step back and forth in history), it woult be better if the replace button did not automatically made the editor jump to the next word. Maybe add a setting that chan change the behaviour of the replace button?

In CODEO (eclipse) every other replace button click makes you replace code, or jump to next match, maybe do it like that?

title: [json] publish schema of the VS Code-specific JSON Schema extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Microsoft has extended JSON Schema 7.0 as part of VSCode. It would be great for Microsoft to publish a "VSCode JSON Schema" so that we can easily find all the available elements for our JSON Schemas.

Example extension that Microsoft did:
`defaultSnippets` as mentioned at the bottom of https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/languages/json

title: Remove IElectronService#openExtensionDevelopmentHostWindow
body:
Follow up from https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/commit/a62c6ee148f724e64b280359040c6c274bec150d where I added a new method to `IExtensionHostDebugService`: `openExtensionDevelopmentHostWindow`. The idea is that this method is to be removed from the renderer facing side of `IWindowsService`. 

I moved @weinand 's code from `web.simpleservices.ts` into the browser variant of `IExtensionHostDebugService`:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/a62c6ee148f724e64b280359040c6c274bec150d/src/vs/workbench/contrib/debug/browser/extensionHostDebugService.ts#L51

The missing piece is to make this nice on the `electron-browser` side of things. That implementation is still talking through the `IWindowsService` to the `electron-main` side. Ideally this goes through a debug specific channel (maybe one exists already?).

**Code pointers:**
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/a62c6ee148f724e64b280359040c6c274bec150d/src/vs/workbench/contrib/debug/electron-browser/extensionHostDebugService.ts#L25

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/a62c6ee148f724e64b280359040c6c274bec150d/src/vs/platform/debug/common/extensionHostDebugIpc.ts#L108

It looks like the launch service in electron-main is also using the method to open an extension development window, so we need to figure that out as well. However I am fine having an extension debug related service also in `electron-main`.

title: Playground causes endless TS LS initialization
body: Issue Type: Bug 1) Help > Open Playground -> `Initialzing JS/TS language features` status bar message never goes away VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.39.0-insider (bdd1971f2cd9d08a8a90e02740f1850afe03da66, 2019-09-17T05:59:55.803Z) OS version: Darwin x64 18.6.0
